channel.title: Bat Country Solo Cover - Audacity
channel.description:
I was playing around with this recording/editing software, Audacity, and it's fucking boss.
[hr]
You get can Audacity here:
http://audacity.sourceforge.net/download/
[hr]
If you play any type of instrument, you can record what ever you're playing and edit it. I recorded a Bat Country solo cover (I used the tabs from the official city of evil tab book). I split it into a 6 figure piece, and just waited until that figure in specific was ready to be played, because Audacity plays back while it records, so it's helpful when you're using a shitty recording method like mine. I used metronome from a website.
Tell me what you think =-).
inb4isuck
Here's the wav:
http://up.ht/fPzbiL
Project file:
http://up.ht/ebD1Tj

Damn near perfect. Sounded pretty good.

I was playing around with this recording/editing software, Audacity, and it’s fucking boss.

SourceForge

Audacity

Download Audacity for free. A free multi-track audio editor and recorder. Audacity is a free, easy-to-use, multi-track audio editor and recorder for Windows, Mac OS X, GNU/Linux and other operating systems. The interface is translated into many...

[hr]

If you play any type of instrument, you can record what ever you’re playing and edit it. I recorded a Bat Country solo cover (I used the tabs from the official city of evil tab book).
I split it into a 6 figure piece, and just waited until that figure in specific was ready to be played, because Audacity plays back while it records, so it’s helpful when you’re using a shitty recording method like mine. I used metronome from a website.

Tell me what you think =-).
